name: Salt Flats
role_in_state: Primary salt supplier and ritual-reagent transshipment hub
economy_niches: Seasonal labor brokerage for saltern work
Repair services for salt-corroded ships and gear
culture_adjustments: Work rhythms tied to evaporation cycles rather than port schedules
High social value on endurance and practical corrosion-proof craft
Mobile saltern camps and seasonal households dominate settlement pattern
Stricter guild control of pan-ownership and labor rotations
Local songs and laments focused on brine and loss rather than long voyages
constraints: Seasonal production curtailed by monsoon/precipitation variability
Ritual magic use expensive due to reagent import dependency
Chronic freshwater scarcity limits permanent urban growth
notes: Key node for state-wide ritual reagent redistribution
Terrain includes crusted pans and concealed mud under a brittle crust
Few permanent burgs; emphasis on mobile infrastructure and pan-maintenance
